title: Midnight Purple II 1999 Nissan Skyline GT-R V-Spec at No Reserve
description: This Midnight Purple II 1999 Nissan Skyline GT-R is one of 4,194 Series 1 V-Specs produced and was imported to the US in around 2020. The car is powered by a twin-turbocharged 2.6L RB26DETT inline-six that sends power to all four wheels through a six-speed manual gearbox, an ATTESA E-TS PRO all-wheel-drive system, and an active limited-slip rear differential. It is further equipped with Brembo brakes, Super HICAS rear-axle steering, 18" Rays TE37s, xenon headlights, a rear wing, and automatic climate control. The selling dealer acquired the car in 2025, and it now has ~87k kilometers (~54k miles). This R34 Skyline GT-R is now offered in at no reserve in California with the owner's manual, service records, and a clean Arizona title.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a No Reserve: Midnight Purple II 1999 Nissan Skyline GT-R V-Spec at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #192,467.
text: This Midnight Purple II 1999 Nissan Skyline GT-R is one of 4,194 Series 1 V-Specs produced and was imported to the US in around 2020. The car is powered by a twin-turbocharged 2.6L RB26DETT inline-six that sends power to all four wheels through a six-speed manual gearbox, an ATTESA E-TS PRO all-wheel-drive system, and an active limited-slip rear differential. It is further equipped with Brembo brakes, Super HICAS rear-axle steering, 18″ Rays TE37s, xenon headlights, a rear wing, and automatic climate control. The selling dealer acquired the car in 2025, and it now has ~87k kilometers (~54k miles). This R34 Skyline GT-R is now offered in at no reserve in California with the owner’s manual, service records, and a clean Arizona title. The car is one of 347 that were ordered in Midnight Purple II (LV4), and exterior equipment includes xenon headlights, an aluminum hood, a rear wing, a rear fog light, a rear fog light, a front splitter, and an integrated rear diffuser. The selling dealer states that paint protection film was applied to the exterior panels. Rays T37 alloys and Yokohama tires have been mounted. The car was factory equipped with Super HICAS rear-axle steering, and stopping power is provided by gold Brembo calipers over ventilated discs at all four corners. Aftermarket suspension has been installed. The right-hand-drive cabin features front bucket seats and a rear bench upholstered in gray cloth, and interior appointments include automatic climate control, power windows, a Pioneer stereo, and driver and passenger front airbags. The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a tachometer with an 8k-rpm redline and an inset oil pressure gauge as well as a 180-km/h speedometer and gauges to monitor coolant temperature and fuel level. A digital screen in the center of the dashboard provides additional information including boost pressure, throttle input, injector workload, and temperature readings. The digital odometer indicates ~87k kilometers (~54k miles). The twin-turbocharged 2.6-liter RB26DETT inline-six is equipped with individual throttle bodies, red-finished timing- and valve covers, dual overhead camshafts, and 24 valves. An adjustable strut brace spans the engine bay, and HKS filters have been installed along with an aftermarket exhaust system. Power is routed to all four wheels through a six-speed manual gearbox, an ATTESA E-TS PRO all-wheel-drive system, and an active limited-slip rear differential. Decoding the model code reveals the following details: G: Two-door coupe GJ: 2.6-liter RB26DETT inline-six P: ATTESA E-TS all-wheel drive with Super HICAS four-wheel steering R: Right-hand drive W: Skyline GT-R V-Spec Y: Six-speed manual transmission R34: Model Z: Twin-turbocharged D: Standard climate package A: Four-person seating capacity A: Super fine hardcoat 14 B: Rear window wiper, UV-cut tinted glass, privacy glass K: Glovebox light, remote control entry, trunk lid trim, multi-display meter, advanced aero system -:  Standard audio D: Rear fog lamp The car has not been inspected by the California Air Resources Board. html:
This Midnight Purple II 1999 Nissan Skyline GT-R is one of 4,194 Series 1 V-Specs produced and was imported to the US in around 2020. The car is powered by a twin-turbocharged 2.6L RB26DETT inline-six that sends power to all four wheels through a six-speed manual gearbox, an ATTESA E-TS PRO all-wheel-drive system, and an active limited-slip rear differential. It is further equipped with Brembo brakes, Super HICAS rear-axle steering, 18″ Rays TE37s, xenon headlights, a rear wing, and automatic climate control. The selling dealer acquired the car in 2025, and it now has ~87k kilometers (~54k miles). This R34 Skyline GT-R is now offered in at no reserve in California with the owner’s manual, service records, and a clean Arizona title.

The car is one of 347 that were ordered in Midnight Purple II (LV4), and exterior equipment includes xenon headlights, an aluminum hood, a rear wing, a rear fog light, a rear fog light, a front splitter, and an integrated rear diffuser. The selling dealer states that paint protection film was applied to the exterior panels.

Rays T37 alloys and Yokohama tires have been mounted. The car was factory equipped with Super HICAS rear-axle steering, and stopping power is provided by gold Brembo calipers over ventilated discs at all four corners. Aftermarket suspension has been installed.

The right-hand-drive cabin features front bucket seats and a rear bench upholstered in gray cloth, and interior appointments include automatic climate control, power windows, a Pioneer stereo, and driver and passenger front airbags.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel frames a tachometer with an 8k-rpm redline and an inset oil pressure gauge as well as a 180-km/h speedometer and gauges to monitor coolant temperature and fuel level. A digital screen in the center of the dashboard provides additional information including boost pressure, throttle input, injector workload, and temperature readings. The digital odometer indicates ~87k kilometers (~54k miles).

The twin-turbocharged 2.6-liter RB26DETT inline-six is equipped with individual throttle bodies, red-finished timing- and valve covers, dual overhead camshafts, and 24 valves. An adjustable strut brace spans the engine bay, and HKS filters have been installed along with an aftermarket exhaust system.

Power is routed to all four wheels through a six-speed manual gearbox, an ATTESA E-TS PRO all-wheel-drive system, and an active limited-slip rear differential.

Decoding the model code reveals the following details:

  • G: Two-door coupe
  • GJ: 2.6-liter RB26DETT inline-six
  • P: ATTESA E-TS all-wheel drive with Super HICAS four-wheel steering
  • R: Right-hand drive
  • W: Skyline GT-R V-Spec
  • Y: Six-speed manual transmission
  • R34: Model
  • Z: Twin-turbocharged
  • D: Standard climate package
  • A: Four-person seating capacity
  • A: Super fine hardcoat 14
  • B: Rear window wiper, UV-cut tinted glass, privacy glass
  • K: Glovebox light, remote control entry, trunk lid trim, multi-display meter, advanced aero system
  • -:  Standard audio
  • D: Rear fog lamp

The car has not been inspected by the California Air Resources Board.
